name: biomarker
description: The collection of data elements describing a donor's biomarker tests. A biomarker is a biological molecule found in blood, other body fluids, or tissues that is indicative of the presence of cancer in the body. Each row should include biomarker tests associated with a particular clinical event or time interval.

fields.name: program_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.
Unique identifier of the donor, assigned by the data provider.
fields.name: submitter_donor_id
submitter_specimen_id
fields.description: Unique identifier of the specimen, assigned by the data provider.

fields.name: submitter_primary_diagnosis_id
fields.description: If the biomarker test was done at the time of primary diagnosis, then indicate the associated submitter_primary_diagnosis_id here.

fields.name: submitter_treatment_id
fields.description: If the biomarker test was done at the initiation of a specific treatment regimen, indicate the associated submitter_treatment_id here.
If the biomarker test was done during a follow-up event, then indicate the associated submitter_follow_up_id here.
fields.name: submitter_follow_up_id

fields.description: If the biomarker test was not associated with a specific follow-up, primary diagnosis or treatment event, then indicate the interval of time since primary diagnosis that the biomarker test was performced at, in days.
fields.name: test_interval

meta.notes: This field is required if the biomarker test is not associated with a primary diagnosis, treatment or follow-up event. The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

fields.description: Indicate the level of carbohydrate antigen 19-9 (CA19-9). Carbohydrate antigen 19-9 testing is useful to monitor the response to treatment in pancreatic cancer patients. (Reference: LOINC: 24108-3)
fields.name: ca19-9_level

fields.description: Indicate the quantitative measurement of the amount of C-reactive protein (CRP), an inflammatory marker, in the blood in mg/L. (Reference: NCIt C64548)
fields.name: crp_levels

fields.description: Indicate the level of lactate dehydrogenase (LDH), in IU/L.
fields.name: ldl_level

fields.description: Indicate the value for a hemotology laboratory test for the absolute number of neutrophil cells (ANC) present in a sample of peripheral blood from a donor, in cells/uL. (Reference: caDSR CDE ID 2180198)
fields.name: anc

fields.description: Indicate the absolute number of lymphocytes (ALC) found in a given volume of blood, as cells/uL. (Reference: NCIt: C113237)
fields.name: alc

fields.description: Indicate whether donor is a carrier of a mutation in a BRCA gene.
fields.name: brca_carrier

fields.description: Indicate the expression of estrogen receptor (ER). (Reference: NAACCR 3827)
fields.name: er_status

fields.description: Indicate the Allred score. The Allred score is based on the percentage of cells that stain positive by immunohistochemistry (IHC) for estrogen receptor (ER) and the intensity of that staining. (Reference: NAACCR: 3828, caDSR CDE ID 2725288)
fields.name: er_allred_score
er_percent_positive
fields.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percent of cells staining estrogen receptor positive by IHC.
Indicate the expression of human epidermal growth factor receptor-2 (HER2) assessed by immunohistochemistry (IHC). (Reference: AJCC 8th Edition, Chapter 48)
fields.name: her2_ihc_status

meta.notes: Negative: 0 or 1+ staining, Equivocal: 2+ staining, Positive: 3+ staining

fields.description: Indicate the expression of human epidermal growth factor receptor-2 (HER2) assessed by in situ hybridization (ISH). (Reference: NAACCR: 3854)
fields.name: her2_ish_status

fields.description: Indicate the expression of progestrone receptor (PR). (Reference: NAACCR 3915)
fields.name: pr_status

fields.description: Indicate the Allred score. The Allred score is based on the percentage of cells that stain positive by IHC for the progesterone receptor (PR) and the intensity of that staining. (Reference: NAACCR: 3916)
fields.name: pr_allred_score
pr_percent_positive
fields.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percent of cells staining progesterone receptor positive by IHC.

Indicate the immunohistochemical test result that refers to the overexpression or lack of expression of programmed death ligand 1 (PD-L1) in a tissue sample of a primary or metastatic malignant neoplasm. (Reference NCIt: C122807)
fields.name: pd-l1_status

fields.description: Indicate the expression of anaplastic lymphoma receptor tyrosine kinase (ALK) as assessed by immunohistochemistry (IHC).
fields.name: alk_ihc_status

fields.description: Indicate the intensity of anaplastic lymphoma receptor tyrosine kinase (ALK) as assessed by immunohistochemistry (IHC).
fields.name: alk_ihc_intensity

fields.description: Indicate the expression of anaplastic lymphoma receptor tyrosine kinase (ALK) as assessed by flurescence in situ hybridization (FISH).
fields.name: alk_fish_status

fields.description: Indicate the expression of receptor lymphoma kinase (ROS1) as assessed by immunohistochemistry (IHC).
fields.name: ros1_ihc_status

fields.description: Indicate the expression of Pan-TRK as assessed by immunohistochemistry (IHC).
fields.name: pan-trk_ihc_status

fields.description: Indicate the expression of gene arrangement involving the RET proto-oncogene (RET1) as assessed by fluoresence in situ hybridization (FISH). RET gene rearrangements are associated with several different neoplastic conditions. (Reference: NCIt C46005)
fields.name: ret_fish_status

fields.description: Indicate the expression of tropomyosin receptor kinase (TRK) as assessed by immunohistochemistry (IHC).
fields.name: trk_ihc_status

fields.description: Indicate the expression of Human papillomavirus (HPV) p16 as assessed by immunohistochemistry (IHC).
fields.name: hpv_ihc_status

fields.description: Indicate the expression of Human papillomavirus (HPV) as assessed using a laboratory test in which cells are scraped from the cervix to look for DNA of HPV. (Reference: NCIt C93141)
fields.name: hpv_dna_status
